creator: Zeno, Jacopo, 1417-1481
title: Vita Caroli Zeni
extent: ff. ii + 192 + i : parchment ; 271 x 177 (177 x 106) mm.
description: Script: Written in humanistic script by Franciscus de Tianis of Pistoia.

On f. 1r, a foliage border which includes hares, stork, vase, and arms of the Piccolomini family (argent, a cross azur with 5 crescents or; surmounted by keys in saltire argent and a papal tiara; supported by a pair of angels). Eleven elaborate initials, 11- to 7-line, in gold, red, blue, and green entwined with foliage. The style of decoration is decidedly Roman.
Binding: Eighteenth century. Brownish-red goatskin, gold-tooled; pale green and gold, Dutch gilt paper boards.
Manuscript on parchment of Jacopo Zeno, Vita Caroli Zeni. With a dedicatory preface to Pope Pius II. This manuscript is of special importance because it contains the complete work.

De Ricci, v. 1, p. 161, no. 2. Exhibition Catalogue: W. Cahn and J. Marrow, eds., "Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts at Yale: A Selection," Yale University Library Gazette 52 (1978), pp. 229-30, no. 54, pl. 20 (f.1r).
Record created by Beinecke staff from catalog description by Barbara Shailor.
genre: Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in Beinecke Library
references: Jacopo Zeno, Vita Caroli Zeni. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.
provenanceUncontrolled: Purchased by William Loring Andrews who presented it to Yale in 1894.
